title: Unique jobs is incompatible with ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::SidekiqAdapter::JobWrapper
body:
Ruby version: 
```
ruby 2.7.1p83 (2020-03-31 revision a0c7c23c9c) [x86_64-darwin19]
```
Sidekiq / Pro / Enterprise version(s): 
```
  * sidekiq (6.1.1)
  * sidekiq-ent (2.1.1)
  * sidekiq-pro (5.1.1)
```

I'm using Active Job and Sidekiq Enterprise.

In my Rails initializer, I added:
```ruby
Sidekiq::Enterprise.unique! unless Rails.env.test?
```

In a job class, I added:
```ruby
class MyJob < ApplicationJob
  sidekiq_options unique_for: 10.minutes
end
```

When I add a debugger to `Sidekiq::Enterprise::Unique::Client#call`, I see that if I enqueue the same job with the same arguments multiple times, the value of the `ctx` string is unique each time, thus defeating the hash comparison.

Particularly, the `job_id` and `enqueued_at` arguments are pretty much guaranteed never to repeat.

Example values for `ctx`:
```
ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::SidekiqAdapter::JobWrapper|default|{"job_class"=>"MyJob", "job_id"=>"df8f34b8-6d46-40f1-87b4-ab83fc466a44", "provider_job_id"=>nil, "queue_name"=>"default", "priority"=>nil, "arguments"=>[48587, {"_aj_ruby2_keywords"=>[]}], "executions"=>0, "exception_executions"=>{}, "locale"=>"en", "timezone"=>"UTC", "enqueued_at"=>"2020-08-11T20:12:52Z"}

ActiveJob::QueueAdapters::SidekiqAdapter::JobWrapper|default|{"job_class"=>"MyJob", "job_id"=>"1854204b-c0d0-486c-9d65-b71f866ebdf1", "provider_job_id"=>nil, "queue_name"=>"default", "priority"=>nil, "arguments"=>[48587, {"_aj_ruby2_keywords"=>[]}], "executions"=>0, "exception_executions"=>{}, "locale"=>"en", "timezone"=>"UTC", "enqueued_at"=>"2020-08-11T20:12:56Z"}
```

My plan is to patch this behavior in my own application, but I wanted to report it here as well.

Thanks!
